Sentencas: Stable composition and catalytic activity of surfaces are among the key requirements for materials employed in energy storage and conversion devices, such as solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Hf Deposition Stabilizes the Surface Chemistry of Perovskite Manganite Oxide

Sentencas: Perovskite oxides that serve as cathode in SOFCs suffer from segregation of the aliovalent substitutional cations and the formation of an inert, non-conductive phase at the surface.
Titulo: Hf Deposition Stabilizes the Surface Chemistry of Perovskite Manganite Oxide

Sentencas: Here, we demonstrate that the surface of the state-of-the-art SOFC cathode material La0.8Sr0.2MnO3 (LSM) is stabilized against the segregation of Sr at high temperature by submonolayer coverages of Hf.
Titulo: Hf Deposition Stabilizes the Surface Chemistry of Perovskite Manganite Oxide

Sentencas: The Hf is vapor-deposited onto the LSM thin film surface by e-beam evaporation.
Titulo: Hf Deposition Stabilizes the Surface Chemistry of Perovskite Manganite Oxide

Sentencas: Using in situ near-ambient pressure X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (NAP-XPS), we analyze the surface composition of LSM thin films.
Titulo: Hf Deposition Stabilizes the Surface Chemistry of Perovskite Manganite Oxide

Sentencas: Half the LSM surface was kept as-prepared, and half was Hf-modified, for a direct comparison of untreated and Hf-treated regions on the same sample.
Titulo: Hf Deposition Stabilizes the Surface Chemistry of Perovskite Manganite Oxide

Sentencas: The formation of a binary SrOx surface species is quantified as descriptor for surface degradation.
Titulo: Hf Deposition Stabilizes the Surface Chemistry of Perovskite Manganite Oxide

Sentencas: The onset of Sr segregation is observed at 450 degrees C on the bare LSM, followed by a substantial advance at 550 degrees C. Hf-treated regions of the same LSM surface exhibit significantly less Sr surface segregation at 450-550 degrees C.
Titulo: Hf Deposition Stabilizes the Surface Chemistry of Perovskite Manganite Oxide

Sentencas: We interpret this stabilization imparted by Hf to arise from the suppression of the electrostatic attraction of Sr2+ cations to surface oxygen vacancies.
Titulo: Hf Deposition Stabilizes the Surface Chemistry of Perovskite Manganite Oxide

Sentencas: Doping the surface layer with Hf, that has a higher affinity to oxygen, reduces this attraction by decreasing the surface oxygen vacancy concentration.
Titulo: Hf Deposition Stabilizes the Surface Chemistry of Perovskite Manganite Oxide

Sentencas: In doing so, the use of physical vapor deposition highlights the direct role of the metal species in this system and excludes artifacts that could be introduced via chemical routes.
Titulo: Hf Deposition Stabilizes the Surface Chemistry of Perovskite Manganite Oxide

Sentencas: The present work demonstrates this stabilizing effect of Hf on the surface of LSM, broadening the relevance of our prior findings on surface metal doping of other perovskite oxides.
Titulo: Hf Deposition Stabilizes the Surface Chemistry of Perovskite Manganite Oxide
